name: Brass Rail Restaurant Company, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Labor Relations Board
name_abbreviation: Brass Rail Restaurant Co. v. Pennsylvania Labor Relations Board

judges: Before Stern, C. J., Stearns, Jones, Bell, Chidsey, Musmanno and Arnold, JJ.
parties: Brass Rail Restaurant Company, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Labor Relations Board.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The decree entered in the Court of Common Pleas, Equity Docket, of Dauphin County is affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Richards. Costs on the appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Gilbert J. Helwig, with him Nicholas TJnkovic, Donald B. Heard, Oarl F. Ghronister and Reed, Smith, Shaw & McGlay, for appellant.
George L. Reed, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him M. Louise Rutherford, Deputy Attorney General and Robert E. Woodside, Attorney General, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Brass Rail Restaurant Company, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Labor Relations Board.
Argued. September 30, 1953.
Before Stern, C. J., Stearns, Jones, Bell, Chidsey, Musmanno and Arnold, JJ.
Gilbert J. Helwig, with him Nicholas TJnkovic, Donald B. Heard, Oarl F. Ghronister and Reed, Smith, Shaw & McGlay, for appellant.
George L. Reed, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him M. Louise Rutherford, Deputy Attorney General and Robert E. Woodside, Attorney General, for appellees.
November 9, 1953:
